remixlab.dandelion.branch

Class KeyboardAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.core.Agent
      • remixlab.bias.branch.GenericAgent
        • remixlab.bias.branch.GenericKeyboardAgent
          • remixlab.dandelion.branch.KeyboardAgent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DroidKeyAgent, KeyAgent

    public abstract class KeyboardAgent
extends GenericKeyboardAgent
    The root of all dandelion keyboard agents. This agent specializes in handling GenericFrame and GrabberScene objects, but it can also handle third-party Grabber or GenericGrabber object instances. In the latter case, third-parties should implement their own KeyboardBranches.

    The agent has a KeyboardBranch<GlobalAction, SceneAction> branch to handle scene instances: the sceneBranch(); and two branches of the type MotionBranch<MotionAction, A, ClickAction> to handle GenericFrame object instances: eyeBranch(), for Constants.Target.EYE (which typically has one one single instance, that of the GrabberScene.eyeFrame()); and frameBranch(), for Constants.Target.FRAME (which may have several instances, see addGrabber(Grabber)). Note that through the aforementioned branches the following Profiles are available: sceneProfile(), eyeProfile() and frameProfile(). Refer to the Branch and Profile for details.

    'Interaction customization', i.e., binding keyboard shortcuts (see KeyboardShortcut) to dandelion global and motion actions, may be achieved through those profiles or through various of the high-level methods conveniently provided by this agent, such as #setBinding(char, SceneAction) or #setBinding(Target, int, KeyboardAction) and so on. Note that to discriminate between the GrabberScene.eyeFrame() from other GenericFrame instances, some methods take an extra Constants.Target parameter.

    The agent's Agent.defaultGrabber() is the GrabberScene.eye() frame (see Eye.frame()) (note that resetDefaultGrabber() will thus defaults to the eye frame too).

    See Also:
    Constants.SceneAction, Constants.KeyboardAction

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyboardAgent

        public KeyboardAgent(GenericScene scn,
                     String n)
        Creates a keyboard agent and appends the sceneBranch(), eyeBranch() and frameBranch() to it. The keyboard agent is added to the GrabberScene.inputHandler().

      • setDefaultBindings

        public void setDefaultBindings()
        Set the default keyboard shortcuts as follows:

        1. Scene bindings: 'a' -> SceneAction.TOGGLE_AXIS_VISUAL_HINT
        'f' -> SceneAction.TOGGLE_FRAME_VISUAL_HINT
        'g' -> SceneAction.TOGGLE_GRID_VISUAL_HINT
        'm' -> SceneAction.TOGGLE_ANIMATION
        'e' -> SceneAction.TOGGLE_CAMERA_TYPE
        'h' -> SceneAction.DISPLAY_INFO
        'r' -> KeyboardAction.TOGGLE_PATHS_VISUAL_HINT
        's' -> SceneAction.INTERPOLATE_TO_FIT
        'S' -> SceneAction.SHOW_ALL
        CTRL + '1' -> SceneAction.ADD_KEYFRAME_TO_PATH_1
        ALT + '1' -> SceneAction.DELETE_PATH_1
        CTRL + '2' -> SceneAction.ADD_KEYFRAME_TO_PATH_2
        ALT + '2' -> SceneAction.DELETE_PATH_2
        CTRL + '3' -> SceneAction.ADD_KEYFRAME_TO_PATH_3
        ALT + '3' -> SceneAction.DELETE_PATH_3

        2. Bindings for the GrabberScene.eyeFrame() and other frame instances: left_arrow -> KeyboardAction.TRANSLATE_X_NEG
        right_arrow -> KeyboardAction.TRANSLATE_X_POS
        up_arrow -> KeyboardAction.TRANSLATE_Y_POS
        down_arrow -> KeyboardAction.TRANSLATE_Y_NEG
        down_arrow -> KeyboardAction.ROTATE_Z_NEG

        Finally, it calls: setKeyCodeToPlayPath('1', 1), setKeyCodeToPlayPath('2', 2) and setKeyCodeToPlayPath('3', 3) to play the paths.

        See Also:
        setDefaultBindings(), setKeyCodeToPlayPath(int, int)

      • setKeyCodeToPlayPath

        public void setKeyCodeToPlayPath(int vkey,
                                 int path)
        Sets the default (virtual) key to play eye paths.

      • setBinding

        public void setBinding(Constants.Target target,
                       KeyboardShortcut shortcut,
                       Constants.KeyboardAction action)
        Defines a keyboard-shortcut binding for the target interactive-frame. Same as motionProfile(target).setBinding(shortcut, action).

        The target may be either (Constants.Target.EYE to point out the GrabberScene.eyeFrame(), or Constants.Target.FRAME to specify the remaining interactive-frames.

        See Also:
        #motionProfile(Target)

      • removeBinding

        public void removeBinding(Constants.Target target,
                          KeyboardShortcut shortcut)
        Removes the target interactive-frame keyboard-shortcut binding. Same as motionProfile(target).removeBinding(shortcut).

        The target may be either (Constants.Target.EYE to point out the GrabberScene.eyeFrame(), or Constants.Target.FRAME to specify the remaining interactive-frames.

        See Also:
        #motionProfile(Target)
